Content.BodyCopy:
Patrick Sorensen

Patrick Sorensen has worked in local government for the past 28 years, serving in Washington State, Oregon, Nevada, and Utah. He is presently the General Manager for Lake Whatcom Water and Sewer District in Bellingham, WA. Over a span of 22 years in his management career, Mr. Sorensen has served as Deputy City Manager, City Manager, Deputy General Manager, and General Manager for public water and sewer utilities. Mr. Sorensen holds a BA in Political Science and BSc in Geography and Urban Planning from BYU, as well as an MPA from the University of Utah. He has also earned a Public Executive Certification from the University of Washington through post-graduate course work in Public Management, and he is a Credentialed Manager in the International City/County Management Association. While in college, he interned with Nevada Senator Paul Laxalt in Washington, DC, and he served a full-time mission for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints in Louisiana and Mississippi.

Roy Huff grew up in Southern California and served an LDS mission in the Germany Hamburg Mission. He double majored in Russian and German, receiving his B.A. from BYU-Provo. He worked with the National Security Agency before becoming a seminary teacher with the Church Educational System. He started the Russian Program at Ricks College in 1990. Five years later he was asked to join the Religion Department as a faculty member. Twice he was asked to teach in Israel at the BYU-Jerusalem Center for a year. In 2004, he served as an Associate Vice President for Curriculum in the BYU-Idaho administration. Currently he serves in the Religious Education Department as a faculty member. From 2002 to 2006, he was the Director of Alumni Travel for BYU-Idaho, leading tours both internationally and domestically.
